headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Public Service Enterprise Group (PEG) Boosting Capital Plan Without Issuing Equity
summary: Earlier this year, Public Service Enterprise Group increased its five-year capital spending plan to US$24 billion, supporting an expected rate base compound annual growth rate of 6% to 7.5% through 2029, and announced it will pursue this investment without new equity issuance or asset sales. This move, paired with the company’s 14th consecutive annual dividend increase to an annualized US$2.52 per share, highlights PSEG's focus on consistently rewarding shareholders. We’ll look at how PSEG’s...
